dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C4116037K] 66.98.252.56 - Hosting Illegal software
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Sent: Tuesday, May 15, 2007 7:38 PM To: Copyright Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C4116037K] 66.98.252.56 - Hosting Illegal Software ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. 66.98.252.56 - Hosting Illegal Software Added by system at Wednesday, May 16 2007 12:35 am X-MailFrom: shivam@socketmail.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Wed May 16 00:35:39 2007 Received: (qmail 25097 invoked by alias); 16 May 2007 05:35:39 -0000 Delivered-To: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net Received: (qmail 25094 invoked from network); 16 May 2007 05:35:39 -0000 Received: from unknown (HELO DALD2EXCH01.PLANET.LOCAL) (172.16.220.10) by inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net with SMTP; 16 May 2007 05:35:39 -0000 Received: from Exchanger.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.102]) by DALD2EXCH01.PLANET.LOCAL with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Wed, 16 May 2007 00:35:39 -0500 Received: from mailin.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.124]) by Exchanger.ev1servers.net with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Wed, 16 May 2007 00:35:38 -0500 X-ASG-Debug-ID: 1179293738-1842-177-0 X-Barracuda-URL: http://207.218.222.124:8000/cgi-bin/mark.cgi X-ASG-Recipient-Whitelist: abuse@ev1servers.net Received: from creative-dr.com (server1.creative-dr.com [209.97.203.218]) by mailin.ev1servers.net (Spam Firewall) with ESMTP id C176979CBB for ; Wed, 16 May 2007 00:35:38 -0500 (CDT) Received: (qmail 11840 invoked from network); 16 May 2007 13:35:27 +0800 Received: from unknown (HELO ShivamParikhPC) (59.95.198.121) by server1.creative-dr.com with SMTP; 16 May 2007 13:35:16 +0800 Message-ID: <6A70802C36AC40D49BCA185886726F45@ShivamParikhPC> From: "Team Socketmail" To: X-ASG-Orig-Subj: 66.98.252.56 - Hosting Illegal Software Subject: 66.98.252.56 - Hosting Illegal Software Date: Wed, 16 May 2007 11:01:49 +0530 MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----=_NextPart_000_00DF_01C797A9.9A5CAAE0" X-Priority: 3 X-MSMail-Priority: Normal X-Mailer: Microsoft Windows Mail 6.0.6000.16386 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.0.6000.16386 X-Virus-Scanned: by Barracuda Spam Firewall at ev1servers.net X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: 0.00 X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=0.00 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED Return-Path: shivam@socketmail.com X-OriginalArrivalTime: 16 May 2007 05:35:38.0988 (UTC) FILETIME=[0939F2C0:01C7977C] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) RE: 66.98.252.56 - Hosting Illegal Software Dear Abuse Team for Ev1Servers, Your client hosted on Server IP 66.98.252.56 , http://66.98.252.56/~adamsstr/mail/ Has installed our software "Socketmail" after doing a chrage-back (apparently fraud). We have contacted him several times to remove the software , without success. Please contact him and have him remove our script / software from your server. We have notified him via email that he has 48 hours to remove it (it is now 42 hours), before we take legal action - this however, means the main server hosts (Ev1servers) would then be liable for hosting illegal software. We hope you can take care of this issue and have the software removed from your clients server. Regards, Shivam Socketmail Team > > > > > ----- Original Message ----- >> Dear Mr./Mrs. Khairul Ariffin, >> >> We regret to inform you we received a chargeback for the order placed by >> Laurence Rose for SocketMail Lite Edition on 01-MAY-2007. >> >> The customer had selected PayPal as the payment option for this order. >> >> Below you will find a copy of the original notification email. >> >> Sincerely, >> Your share-it! team >> ____________________________________________________ >> >> share-it! - a service of digital river >> http://www.shareit.de >> ____________________________________________________ >> >> >> Program = 154923 >> Number of licenses = 1 >> ShareIt Ref # = 123219775 >> Reseller = >> Promotion name = >> >> Net sales = USD -99.00 >> Net discount = USD 0.00 >> Sales tax/VAT collected for you = USD -18.81 >> Shipping charges = USD 0.00 >> Sales tax/VAT on shipping charges = USD 0.00 >> Our service fee = USD 2.96 >> Sales tax/VAT on service fee = USD 0.00 >> Total amount = USD -114.85 >> >> User data: >> Salutation = >> Title = >> Last Name = Rose >> First Name = Laurence >> Company = >> Street = Taliesin, The Street >> ZIP = ME14 4ER >> City = Bearsted, Maidstone >> FullCity = Bearsted, Maidstone, ME14 4ER >> Country = United Kingdom >> State / Province = >> Phone = >> Fax = >> E-Mail = riveracomplete@gmail.com >> VAT ID = >> Payment = PayPal >> Registration name = Laurence Rose >> Language = English >> Additional information: google >> The customer selected the following delivery type: e-mail. >> >> >> > MIME element (text/html) RE: 66.98.252.56 - Hosting Illegal Software


Dear Abuse Team for Ev1Servers,

Your client hosted on Server IP 66.98.252.56 ,
http://66.98.252.56/~adamsstr /mail/

Has installed our software "Socketmail" after doing a chrage-back
(apparently fraud). We have contacted him several times to remove the
software , without success. Please contact him and have him remove our
script / software from your server.

We have notified him via email that he has 48 hours to remove it (it is now
42 hours), before we take legal action - this however, means the main server
hosts (Ev1servers) would then be liable for hosting illegal software. We
hope you can take care of this issue and have the software removed from your
clients server.

Regards,
Shivam

Socketmail Team


>
>
>
>
